Advisor: title of the robot adviser, used for player hints and advice
Check words after play: Types.WordCheck.AFTER: check played words after play is complete
Create game: label on button in game management UI
Delay: label: Input in add robot dialog
Delete: Button text to delete a game
Disabled: Log message when advice is enabled
Enabled: Log message when advice is enabled
Game: label for edition select in game setup dialog
ID: header for the first column in the games table
Last play: Games list column showing when the game was last played
Leader Board: Title of the leader board block
Lose points: Types.Penalty.PER_TURN: failed challenge penalty, lose a fixed number of points
Name: LoginDialog: placeholder for username input
None: 'None' option in select lists in dialogs
Observe game: Button text to observe a game
Reject unknown words: Types.WordCheck.REJECT: reject unknown words before play is accepted
btn-sendrem: Button for sending an email reminder
XANADO problem: Alert to user reporting an error on the server
You: Substitute for name of current player in player table
Your: Possessive at the start of a description e.g. 'Your go'
_hint_: Cheat log message; word $1, row $2, column $3, for $4 points
advised: log: message when player $1 requests advice
already-reg: error when re-registering known user, $1 is the user name
bad-user: User manager: reporting unknown user $1 during signin
btn-accept: Button text to accept last move without a challenge
btn-challenge: label: button in log window, $1 is challengeable player
btn-done: Button text to commit a play
eml-html-link: link in email html, $1 is the url
eml-text-link: link in email plain, $1 is the URL
eml-reset: HTML body of a password reset email, $1 is the url
eml-resplain: plain text of password reset email. $1 is url of reset link
failed: error dialog title, $1 is the action that failed
fuck off: invitation email body, $1 is the url
game-paused: Indicate that $1 has paused timed game
hinted: log: message sent to all players when player $1 asks for a hint
label-forgot: User manager: text above forgotton password link
label-or-email: label for input accepting an email address for a player
label-placed: label: checkbox in user settings dialog
label-unpause: label: button to un-pause the game
lbl-1-win: label: checkbox in user settings dialog
lbl-msgbox: label: textbox for a personal message to include with invitation email
lbl-no-enable: label: checkbox in user settings dialog
lbl-takeback: label: checkbox in game create dialog
lbl-undo: label: checkbox in game create dialog
lock-clkloss: $1 is You or a player name, $2 is points lost
log-chall-fail: log: message, $1 is You or player's, $2 is Your or player's
log-challfail: message when the game ended after a failed challenge failed
log-challloss: points lost to a challenge. $1 is You or player, $2 is failed challenge points
log-challwon: log: message, $1 is You or player's, $2 is Your or player's
log-fromracks: End-of-game log message, $1 is player name, $2 is points
log-miss-turn: Failed challenge outcome, $1 is You or player
log-no-play: log: message when advisor can't find a play
log-no-tiles: Log message when you can have no more tiles
log-player-s: reference to players name, usually simply $1
log-rackloss: $1 is the player, $2 is the points lost, $3 is the list of letters still on their rack
log-swapped: message reporting tile swap, $1 s the number of tiles
log-timed-out: message when game has timed out
log-took-back: log message after a turn is taken back back
log-turn: log: action part of turn description
log-two-passes: message when game ended because all players passed twice
log-winner: log: message when $1 (player name, names, or You) wins. $2 is the number of players who won
log-word-added: log: message sent to all players when player $1 adds a new word, $2, to the dictionary $3
long-M: Long text in the middle square, should always be *
long-_: Long text in a 'normal' square (always blank)
nfy-chall-wonB: Notify body content when a challenge to your play succeeded, $1 is the challenger, $2 the points lost
nfy-game-overH: state when the game is over
nfy-on-rack: message when letter $1 was typed into the board but is not on the rack
nfy-theyfailB: Notify body content when a challenge failed, $1 is the challenger
nfy-theyfailH: Notify title when a challenge failed
nfy-took-backB: Notify body content when move retracted, $1 is the player who retracted
nfy-took-backH: Notify title for a retracted move notification
nfy-you-failedB: Notify body when a challenge failed
nfy-you-failedH: Notify title when a challenge failed
nfy-your-turnB: Notify body when $1 has finished their turn and it's now your turn
nfy-your-turnH: Notify title when it's your turn
no-email: alert when a reminded player $1 doesn't have an email
observer: Message used in UI when observing, $1 is observer name
observers: used in scores block when there are $1 observers
pass-changed: $1 is the user for whom the pass changed
played-for: log: message sent to other players when player $1 asks the robot to take their play
player-reminded: alert dialog message and title when a player or players $1 are reminded
players-tail: Presenting a list of N players; $1 is a player or a comma-separated list of N-1 players, $2 is the Nth player in the list
possible-score: post-play Advisor indication of a better play $1 is word, $2 row, $3 col, $4 score
seconds: placeholder text in add robot dialog
sent-invite: message sent to ui after players $1 are sent invitation
short-M: Short text in the middle square, should always be *
signed-in-as: Used in User manager and Ui to indicate who is logged in. $1 is the name of the player.
state-playing: game state in games table, game in progress
state-waiting: game state in games table, waiting for players
tiles-left: Letter bag status in the Scores block, $1 is number of tiles left
title-game-dlg: title for game dialog, $1 is game id
tt-allow-undo: undo checkbox in game setup dialog
tt-check-type: word check type select in game setup dialog
tt-edition: edition select in create game dialog
tt-game-setup: seetup button in standalone UI and 'Game setup' button in Game dialog
tt-library: on button that opens game library
tt-points-lost: number of points lost for failed challenge in game settings dialog
tt-predict: predict score checkbox in create game dialog
tt-remove-robot: remove robot button in game dialog
tt-robot-dic: dictionary select in game setup dialog
tt-robot-wait: robot delay before play in add robot dialog
tt-sendrem: individual email reminder button in game dialog
tt-time-penalty: penalty for going over time in game dialog
tt-turn-timer: max turn time in game dialog
txt-clipped: dialog body when copied to clipboard
txt-created: Message when a game is created, $1 is the game
txt-enjoy: dialog body when a game is created
txt-leader: leader board player entry, $1 is the player's position, $2 their name, $3 their total score, $4 the number of games player, $5 the number of games won
txt-no-email: Message when mail system is not configured
txt-observer: message when a logged in user observes a game
txt-servdisco: Alert text when server can't be contacted
txt-sign-in: Text at top of page when player no-one is signed in
undone: log: message reporting a successful undo, $1 is what was undone, $2 is who we are waiting for
warn-2-tiles: message when first word not long enough
warn-disco: Scores message when placement is invalid
warn-uncentred: output to the score block when the centre hasn't got a letter in it
word-not-found: log: message when a word $1 is not found in dictionary $2
word-rejected: Log message when a player word is auto-rejected $1 is just used for pluralisation, $2 is the missing word
word-there: output when an allowed word $1 didn't need to be added to dictionary $2
wrong-pass: reporting a bad password during signin, $1 is the user name
your: posessive embedded in a sentence e.g. 'It's your go'
